# effectiveContentHorizontalAlignment

**Instance Property**

The horizontal alignment currently in effect for the control.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var effectiveContentHorizontalAlignment: UIControl.ContentHorizontalAlignment { get }
```

## Discussion

This property always contains the value [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIControl/ContentHorizontalAlignment-swift.enum/left] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIControl/ContentHorizontalAlignment-swift.enum/right], even when the actual horizontal alignment is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIControl/ContentHorizontalAlignment-swift.enum/leading] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIControl/ContentHorizontalAlignment-swift.enum/trailing].

## Specifying content alignment

- **contentVerticalAlignment**: The vertical alignment of content within the control’s bounds.
- **UIControl.ContentVerticalAlignment**: Constants for specifying the vertical alignment of content (text and images) in a control.
- **contentHorizontalAlignment**: The horizontal alignment of content within the control’s bounds.
- **UIControl.ContentHorizontalAlignment**: The horizontal alignment of content (text and images) within a control.
